Description.val:
The C-2A(R) Greyhound is a high wing monoplane, twin engine turbo-prop aircraft capable of operating from both a shore base and all operational United States Navy aircraft carrier classes.  The mission of the C-2A(R) is to provide rapid response Carrier Onboard Delivery of fleet essential supplies, repair parts, and personnel to sustain at sea operations of deployed battle groups.  In addition, the C-2A(R) provides airdrop delivery and mobilization support for special operations forces from land bases and carriers.  The design service life of the C-2A(R) was 10,000 flight hours with 15,000 landings. The goal of the Critical Components Operational Safety Improvement Program (11-07) is to continue procurement efforts for the multiple modifications. Critical Components are composed of Communication Avionics and Radio Upgrades, Engine Power & Propulsion, Ejector valve, and Transducer Engineering Change Proposals.  The C-2 Critical Brake Upgrade Operational Safety Improvement Program (04-16) provides funding for air vehicle modifications to improve operational ground controllability of C-2A aircraft.  The Structural Enhancement Operational Safety Improvement Program (14-17) is to target improvement to structural integrity.  These improvements are a vital requirement for C-2 to maintain the aircraft in the Fleet.  The modification to the wing center section is to prevent structural cracks due to fatigue.  There is a total number of 35 C-2A aircraft.

Funding was added to the "Cost To Complete" amounts.  Funding is required to complete the Critical Components (OSIP 11-07) and the Structural Enhancement (OSIP 14-17) programs.

FY19 Support and Installation funding is required to support additional Critical Brake and Wing Center Section Kits procured with prior year funds.

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $7.788 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

Justification.val: The Critical Components program will continue through the service life of the airframe. The the C-2 Critical Brake Upgrade Operational Safety Improvement Program began in FY16.  The Structural Enhancements modification began in FY17.  Basis for FY19 request is to procure the Wing Center Section, Ejector Valves, Arc-210, and Critical Brakes Kits, Installs, and associated program costs.

Name.@footnote: FY19 increase in ILS due to additional support required to begin ARC-210 Procurement.
FY19 increase in Other Support due to support required to begin ARC-210 Procurement.

FY19 Critical Components funding request was reduced by $2.665M due to ARC-210 software delays which have slid kit procurements to begin in FY2019 .  FY21 kits will be installed in To Complete due to FY22 and FY23 funding being removed.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Depot Field Mod Team:: Installation Name: ARC-210

Description.val:
The C-2A(R) Service Life Extension Program (SLEP) extended the Navy's Carrier Onboard Delivery capability beyond current projected service life.  With a longer air vehicle life, problems with other non-SLEP systems require upgrade/modifications.  This Operational Safety and Improvement Program procures a portion of the Critical Components communication avionics, radios, transducers, ejector valves, power and propulsion subsystems. 

Basis for FY19 request is to procure the Ejector Valve components and it's associated program support.

FY19 Critical Components funding request was reduced by $2.665M due to ARC-210 software delays which have slid the kit procurements to begin in FY 2019.

Name.@footnote: Critical Brakes A Kits: The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $1.347 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances. FY16, FY17 and FY18 kit quantities were adjusted accordingly.  FY19 support and install funding required to support additional kits procured with FY17 funds.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Field Mod Team:: Installation Name: Critical Brake Upgrade

Description.val:
The C-2A(R) Greyhound Critical Brake Upgrade adds an Anti-Skid Brake System (ABS) to the aircraft which helps mitigate directional stability safety issues by enhancing ground controllability for land based runway conditions.

FY19 funds are for Critical Brake Upgrade installs and program support for kits procured with prior year execution balances, and upgrading the critical brake trainer software.  FY19 Critical Brake Upgrade funding request was reduced by $1.347M due to availability of prior year funds.  FY16, FY17 and FY18 kit quantities were adjusted accordingly.  

DEVELOPMENT STATUS/MAJOR DEVELOPMENT MILESTONES:
Preliminary Design Review completed 3RD QTR of FY13.  Critical Design Review completed 4TH QTR of FY13.  Flight Testing began 2ND QTR FY16.

Name.@footnote: The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $3.470M due to availability of prior year funds.  FY17 & FY18 kit quantities were adjusted accordingly.  FY21 kit will be installed in To Complete due to FY 22 and FY23 funding being removed.  FY18 Funding will be used to procure both FY18 and FY19 Kits.  FY18 Kits will award in Nov 2018 and begin to install Jul 2019.  FY19 Kits will award Nov 2019 and begin install in FY20.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Field Mod Team:: Installation Name: Wing Center Section

Description.val:
The structural enhancements to the C-2 series aircraft target improvements to structural integrity and support costs.  These improvements are a vital requirement for C-2 to maintain the aircraft in the Fleet until the planned sundown.  Structural changes to the wing center section will increase survivability, improve maintainability and aircraft availability, eliminate component interferences, improve suitability and correct safety related issues.  This effort will take the C-2 Fleet to full service life.

FY19 funding is required for Installs and associated program costs for Wing Center Section Kits procured with prior year execution balances.  

The FY 2019 funding request was reduced by $3.470M due to availability of prior year funds.  FY17 & FY18 kit quantities were adjusted accordingly.
